description: Helper class that takes in a string and stores and generates a vector of Path segments. Provides methods for generating GraphicsPath and calculating bounds.

members.description: Constructor.
A Vector of the actual path segments. May be empty, but always non-null.
The bounds of the segments in local coordinates.
width, height and then transformed with transformation matrix m.

values: Returns the axis aligned bounding box of the segments stretched to

members.description: Workhorse method that iterates through the segments array and draws each path egment based on its control points. Segments are drawn from the x and y position of the path. Additionally, segments are drawn by taking into account the scale applied to the path. path segment should be drawn path segment should be drawn this path segment path segment

values: tx A Number representing the x position of where this
ty A Number representing the y position of where this
sx A Number representing the scaleX at which to draw
sy A Number representing the scaleY at which to draw this

description: The PathSegment class is the base class for a segment of a path. This class is not created directly. It is the base class for MoveSegment, LineSegment, CubicBezierSegment and QuadraticBezierSegment.

members.description: Constructor.

values: _x The x position of the pen in the current coordinate system.
_y The y position of the pen in the current coordinate system.

members.description: The ending x position for this segment.
The ending y position for this segment.
Draws this path segment. You can determine the current pen position by reading the x and y values of the previous segment.

values: g The graphics context to draw into.
prev The previous segment drawn, or null if this is the first segment.

members.description: path segment.

values: prev The previous segment drawn, or null if this is the first segment.
sx Pre-transform scale factor for x coordinates.
sy Pre-transform scale factor for y coordinates.
rect If non-null, rect is expanded to include the bounding box of the segment.
Returns the union of rect and the axis aligned bounding box of the post-transformed

members.description: Returns the tangent for the segment.

values: prev The previous segment drawn, or null if this is the first segment.
start If true, returns the tangent to the start point, otherwise the tangend to the end point.
sx Pre-transform scale factor for x coordinates.
sy Pre-transform scale factor for y coordinates.
result The tangent is returned as vector (x, y) in result.

description: The LineSegment draws a line from the current pen position to the coordinate located at x, y.

members.description: Constructor.  this value to determine where to draw to.  this value to determine where to draw to.

values: x The current location of the pen along the x axis. The draw() method uses
y The current location of the pen along the y axis. The draw() method uses

members.description: Returns the tangent for the segment.

values: prev The previous segment drawn, or null if this is the first segment.
start If true, returns the tangent to the start point, otherwise the tangend to the end point.
sx Pre-transform scale factor for x coordinates.
sy Pre-transform scale factor for y coordinates.
result The tangent is returned as vector (x, y) in result.

description: The MoveSegment moves the pen to the x,y position. This class calls the Graphics.moveTo() method from the draw() method.

members.description: Constructor.

values: x The target x-axis location in 2-d coordinate space.
y The target y-axis location in 2-d coordinate space.

members.description: The MoveSegment class moves the pen to the position specified by the x and y properties.

description:
The CubicBezierSegment draws a cubic bezier curve from the current pen position to x, y. The control1X and control1Y properties specify the first control point; the control2X and control2Y properties specify the second control point.

Cubic bezier curves are not natively supported in Flash Player. This class does an approximation based on the fixed midpoint algorithm and uses 4 quadratic curves to simulate a cubic curve.

For details on the fixed midpoint algorithm, see:
http://timotheegroleau.com/Flash/articles/cubic_bezier_in_flash.htm

members.description:
Constructor.

For a CubicBezierSegment, there are two control points, each with x and y coordinates. Control points are points that define the direction and amount of curves of a Bezier curve. The curved line never reaches the control points; however, the line curves as though being drawn toward the control point.

values: _control1X The x-axis location in 2-d coordinate space of the first control point.
_control1Y The y-axis location of the first control point.
_control2X The x-axis location of the second control point.
_control2Y The y-axis location of the second control point.
x The x-axis location of the starting point of the curve.
y The y-axis location of the starting point of the curve.

members.description: The first control point x position.
The first control point y position.
The second control point x position.
The second control point y position.
Draws the segment.

values: g The graphics context where the segment is drawn.
prev The previous location of the pen.

members.description: Returns the tangent for the segment.

values: prev The previous segment drawn, or null if this is the first segment.
start If true, returns the tangent to the start point, otherwise the tangend to the end point.
sx Pre-transform scale factor for x coordinates.
sy Pre-transform scale factor for y coordinates.
result The tangent is returned as vector (x, y) in result.

description: Utility class to store the computed quadratic points.

members.description: Constructor.

description: The QuadraticBezierSegment draws a quadratic curve from the current pen position to x, y.  Quadratic bezier is the native curve type in Flash Player.

members.description:
Constructor.

For a QuadraticBezierSegment, there is one control point. A control point is a point that defines the direction and amount of a Bezier curve. The curved line never reaches the control point; however, the line curves as though being drawn toward the control point.

values: _control1X The x-axis location in 2-d coordinate space of the control point.
_control1Y The y-axis location in 2-d coordinate space of the control point.
x The x-axis location of the starting point of the curve.
y The y-axis location of the starting point of the curve.

members.description: The control point's x position.
The control point's y position.
Draws the segment using the control point location and the x and y coordinates. This method calls the Graphics.curveTo() method.

values: g The graphics context where the segment is drawn.
prev The previous location of the pen.

members.description: Returns the tangent for the segment.

values: prev The previous segment drawn, or null if this is the first segment.
start If true, returns the tangent to the start point, otherwise the tangend to the end point.
sx Pre-transform scale factor for x coordinates.
sy Pre-transform scale factor for y coordinates.
result The tangent is returned as vector (x, y) in result.

description: The EllipticalArcSegment draws an arc from the current point to a specified point. The arc command begins with the x and y radius and ends with the ending point of the arc. Between these are three other values: x axis rotation, large arc flag and sweep flag. The x axis rotation is used to rotate the ellipse that the arc is created from. This rotation maintains the start and end points, whereas a rotation with the transform attribute (outside the path description) would cause the entire path, including the start and end points, to be rotated. The large arc flag and sweep flag control which part of the ellipse is used to cut the arc. These are needed because there's more than one way to place an ellipse so that it includes the start and end points.   Derieved from the svgweb library Original found here https://code.google.com/p/svgweb/source/browse/trunk/src/org/svgweb/utils/EllipticalArc.as?r=1251

members.description: Constructor.

values: angle angle of rotation from the x-axis
largeArcFlag true if arc is greater than 180 degrees
sweepFlag determines if the arc proceeds in a postitive or negative radial direction
LastPointX starting x value of arc
LastPointY starting y value of arc
